title: Mum vows she'll never have another child after finding her baby dead at home
text:

A grieving mum says she can't ever contemplate having another child following after the tragic loss of her "beautiful" eight-month-old baby.

Little Bonnie-Olivia died earlier this year of SUDI, the sudden unexpected death of an infant.

Mum Kayla Weeks, 18, and her partner Jake Fitt's world collapsed when she discovered their daughter dead at their Essex home.

But brave Kayla and Jake, 21, are aiming to raise money and awareness by speaking publicly about their trauma.

"When she was born, she saved my life," she told EssexLive . "She gave me a purpose, she was such an amazing baby.

"Everyone said they felt like she had been there before.

"She was such a good baby, she slept through the night and she was beautiful.

"I'll never get over it, every time I see a baby."

Her passing has had such a profound impact on Kayla that she now says she just can't consider having another baby in the future.

"I do not want to have another, she was my only one," she said.

"I had a flat and it was just me and Bonnie - she was my best friend. Everyone said she lit up the room she was in."

Jake, meanwhile, used to look after Bonnie every weekend in his home in Basildon.

The last time Jake saw her was just a day before she died.

"I had her every single weekend without fail," he said.

"I had her on the weekend and on the Monday she passed away. On Monday I was round my new girlfriend's house and I get a phone call from her mother saying she's not breathing.

"I spun my car around as quickly as I could - it was the worst day of my life. She was a real character for her age.

"Anywhere she went, she was the centre of the room."

Jake has decided to run 11 miles on Christmas day in memory of Bonnie with the help and support of Kayla.

He set up a JustGiving page to raise money for The Lullaby Trust which has already raised over £1000 in less than two days.
